JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Undervisningsassistent/Teaching Assistant for the Department of Digitalization
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Will you like to contribute to great teaching at the Department of Digitalization, then apply for a position as our new teaching assistant.
A teaching assistant position in various fields within digitalization is available at the Department of Digitalization, for appointment on the 1st of August 2022.

The position is a temporary part-time position for a fixed term of three years with the possibility of two three-year extensions.

The Department of Digitalization is the largest of its kind in Europe. Our aspirations are equally grand in both research and education and we hope you will help us make the latter even better.

We are specifically looking for teaching in the fields below:
  • Innovation and IT
  • Computer networks and distributed systems
  • Data Analytics

Duties
  • Teaching in digitalization
  • Online teaching – blended learning
  • Supervision of students
  • Possibly exams

Qualifications

The position normally requires a relevant master’s degree or equivalent. Teaching qualifications will be taken into consideration in the assessment.

Terms of employment

The appointment will be in accordance with the circular on hourly-paid teaching under the Ministry of Finance. The hours of work can vary according to needs in the individual semesters to a maximum of 780 hours per academic year. The new employee must be willing to take a pedagogical course arranged by CBS and participate in lecturer meetings.

The recruitment process

Copenhagen Business School invites all qualified candidates to apply for the position.?An appointment committee will review the applications and invite a selection of qualified candidates to an interview.

One of CBS’ strategic goals is the promotion of diversity, which is why every effort has been made to ensure a recruitment process that reduces potential bias.?Applicants are therefore encouraged not to include a photo or unnecessary personal information in their application.

Additional information

You are welcome to contact Cecilie Ostenfeld at co.digi@cbs.dk for more information on the position.

Your application

Your application must be made online. Open the link “Apply online”, fill in the application form, and include information on previous employment, academic record, CV and other relevant details.

Information on relevant previous teaching activities – including duration – must be given in the application. Documentation for these activities and teaching and other special qualifications must be appended to the application.

Applications will be treated in accordance with the statutory order of 31 August 2000, so that applications received will be assessed by an expert.

Applicants are asked to include a list of publications, specifying which of them should be assessed.

Applications will be treated in accordance with the statutory order on the appointment of academic staff in universities (the appointment regulation).

Further information on CBS and the institution is available at www.cbs.dk/digi

Ansøgningsfrist: 16-05-2022

WE TRANSFORM SOCIETY WITH BUSINESS

CBS er et globalt anerkendt business universitet med dybe rødder i den nordiske, socioøkonomiske model. Vi har et bredt fokus på erhvervslivets og samfundets udfordringer i det 21. århundrede. Derfor har vi en samlet portefølje af tværfaglig forskning og uddannelse af høj kvalitet, der har styrket generationer af fagfolk og ledere i den private sektor og andre steder.

Universitetet ligger på Frederiksberg og har ca. 21.000 fuldtids- og deltidsstuderende, 760 fuldtidsansatte videnskabelige medarbejdere, 210 ph.d.-studerende og 680 administrative medarbejdere samt en portefølje af bachelor-, kandidat-, MBA/EMBA-, ph.d.-og efter-/videreuddannelser udbudt på både dansk og engelsk.

Med vores globale profil følger en forpligtelse til at bidrage til udviklingen af transformative kompetencer hos studerende, kandidater og virksomhedsledere gennem vores uddannelsesaktiviteter og muligheder for livslang læring. Komplekse udfordringer kræver en fælles indsats, og derfor fokuserer vores strategi på at styrke nuværende og starte nye partnerskaber med andre videnskaber, erhvervslivet, myndigheder og civilsamfundet.
